mapper.select: select count(*) from review where isbn=#{isbn}
SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT r.review_id) FROM review r JOIN book b ON r.isbn = b.isbn JOIN orders_detail od ON b.isbn = od.isbn JOIN orders o ON od.order_id = o.order_id WHERE r.user_id = #{user_id}

SELECT order_id, TO_CHAR(created_at, 'YYYY-MM-DD') AS created_at, book_title, content, TO_CHAR(reg_date, 'YYYY-MM-DD') AS reg_date, review_id FROM ( SELECT ROWNUM AS rank, a.* FROM ( SELECT MIN(o.order_id) AS order_id, MIN(o.created_at) AS created_at, b.book_title, r.content, r.reg_date, r.review_id FROM orders o JOIN orders_detail od ON o.order_id = od.order_id JOIN book b ON od.isbn = b.isbn JOIN review r ON od.isbn = r.isbn AND o.user_id = r.user_id WHERE o.user_id = #{user_id} GROUP BY b.book_title, r.content, r.reg_date, r.review_id ORDER BY MIN(o.order_id) ASC ) a ) WHERE rank > #{start} AND rank < #{end}
SELECT ROUND(AVG(RATING), 1) AS AVG_RATING FROM review WHERE ISBN = #{isbn} GROUP BY ISBN
